content.title: How Olympic windsurfers are fighting invasive alien species
content.description: Invasive non-native species are thriving, but some Olympic sailors, windsurfers and rowers are helping to combat this destructive flora and fauna.

blocks.altText: Alice Read reaches for the water as she windsurfs (Credit: Max Miechowski)

content.title: Watch: Astronauts enjoy zero-gravity Olympics
content.description: As the Olympics kicks off on earth, astronauts working on the International Space Station wish athletes well.

blocks.altText: A woman, mimicking a weightlifter, pushes up a bar with two men on either end

content.title: EU regulator rejects Alzheimer's drug lecanemab
content.description: It said the benefits of the treatment did not outweigh the risk of serious side effects.

blocks.altText: A human brain being scanned in a neurology clinic

content.title: Actors go on strike over video games AI threat
content.description: The union has been in talks with big games studios, like Activision and Walt Disney, for 18 months.

blocks.altText: Scene from Activision's Call of Duty: Black Ops 6.

content.title: What's behind the global self-storage boom?
content.description: Rising rents, e-commerce and available property are contributing to a boom in self-storage.

blocks.altText: A woman pulls up the door of a self-storage locker

content.title: Tech Decoded: Sign up to our newsletter
content.description: Get timely, trusted tech news from BBC correspondents around the world, every Monday and Friday.

blocks.altText: Tech Decoded: Sign up to our newsletter

content.title: Lawmaker uses AI voice clone to address Congress
content.description: Virginia Congresswoman Jennifer Wexton has a rare neurological condition that makes it difficult for her to speak.

blocks.altText: Congresswoman Jennifer Waxton stands in front of a podium while looking at her iPad. She has a pen in her hand. To her right, there is a female staring at her.

content.title: ChatGPT reveals search feature in Google challenge
content.description: OpenAI is working on adding new search powers to its artificial intelligence (AI) bot.

blocks.altText: a woman in a red cardigan looks at her phone

content.title: How your gut microbes shape your health
content.description: A bustling community of trillions of cells influence almost every aspect of our life.

blocks.altText: Health Decoded

content.title: Is cold water swimming good for you?
content.description: We explore the range of health benefits linked to cold water swimming.

blocks.altText: Health Decoded pt4

content.title: Why women 'need less exercise than men'
content.description: There is a gender gap in just how much exercise we need for healthy hearts.

blocks.altText: Health Decoded pt3 copy

content.title: How 'tapping therapy' can help calm your mind
content.description: A simple on the go therapy could help ease anxiety, stress and reduce the impact of traumatic memories.

blocks.altText: Healthdecoded Tapping Therapy

content.title: Can this mineral help reduce anxiety?
content.description: There's a lot of hype around magnesium and its ability to alleviate anxiety and depression.

blocks.altText: Health Decoded contept art

content.title: The bizarre history of internet outages
content.description: In a world where a single point of failure can throw our machines into chaos, everything from sharks to authoritarian governments to old ladies have brought the web to its knees.

blocks.altText: Woman celebrating Y2K (Credit: Getty Images)

content.title: How America's porn wars could change your internet
content.description: Papers please: for millions of Americans, accessing online pornography now requires a government ID. It could have global implications for the future of the web.

blocks.altText: Graphic of man in front of red white and blue striped screen (Credit: Serenity Strull/BBC/Getty Images)

content.title: The lost Olympic sport of 'distance plunging'
content.description: In the plunge for distance, any form of exertion was strictly forbidden.

blocks.altText: Swimmers in a pool(Credit: Dave Parrington)

content.title: The hidden benefits of volunteering
content.description: In a bid to improve health and wellbeing, social prescriptions can cover everything from volunteering and art classes to support with household bills. But do they really work?

blocks.altText: A female volunteer helps to sort clothes with group of people (Credit: Getty)

content.title: Want to live a long life? Start prioritising friends
content.description: Your social network may influence your health as much as your exercise routine.

blocks.altText: Three women running (Credit: Getty Images)

content.title: Why you are probably sitting for too long
content.description: Sitting down is ingrained in most peoples' days. But staying sedentary for too long can increase the risk of serious health conditions like cardiovascular disease and type 2 diabetes.

blocks.altText: Two people sit in deck chairs surrounded by water (Credit: Getty Images)

content.title: Summer surge: why Covid-19 isn't yet seasonal
content.description: Covid-19 doesn't follow normal seasonal patterns, like other respiratory viruses – waves of infection can happen at any time of year.

blocks.altText: Women in protective Covid-19 masks cool themselves with fans in Tokyo, July 2022 (Credit: Getty Images)

content.title: Walking through time at the Natural History Museum
content.description: A new bronze diplodocus and garden exploring the origins of time opens at the world-famous museum.

blocks.altText: A bronze diplodocus statue at the Natural History Museum

content.title: Moment Ariane-6 rocket blasts into space on first flight
content.description: The vehicle set off from a launchpad in French Guiana on a demonstration mission.

blocks.altText: Column of fire after rocket sets off from launch pad

content.title: High winds and heavy rain as Caribbean hit by hurricane
content.description: Hurricane Beryl has made landfall with floods in Barbados, St Vincent and the Grenadines and Grenada.

blocks.altText: High winds and waves on coast

content.title: UN arms embargo violated in Sudan, investigation finds
content.description: The BBC has found evidence that both the Sudanese army and RSF have used foreign drones in the war.

blocks.altText: A damaged car and houses in Omdurman, March 2024

content.title: Astronauts in Boeing capsule arrive at space station
content.description: Nasa’s Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore were welcomed with hugs and applause, after docking successfully.

blocks.altText: Astronaut Suni Williams arrives at International Space Station

content.title: Why scientists are using a crossbow to study whales
content.description: Researchers use the device to take remote biopsies from wild humpback whales to monitor their health.

blocks.altText: Humpback whale's tail

content.title: How a kettle could help keep older people safe
content.description: AI linked to everyday items could alert family members if elderly relatives have diverted from their normal morning routine.

blocks.altText: Allan Fraser

content.title: Duckling family march to safety at Hardwick Hall
content.description: The annual duck march has been a tradition at Sedgefield’s Hardwick Hall Hotel for the past 24 years.

blocks.altText: Female duck and chicks

content.title: Video captures new mountain lion spotted in Hollywood
content.description: While the giant cats are native to California, it is rare for them to make their way into the city of Los Angeles.

blocks.altText: Mountain lion in Los Angeles

content.title: Malnourished sea lion jumps into rowing boat
content.description: The animal stayed in the boat for over 15 minutes and was later taken to get medical care.

blocks.altText: Sea lion on row boat

content.title: Rare footage shows deep-sea squid attacking camera
content.description: Watch video of the super-fast Dana squid getting a close-up 1km below the Pacific Ocean's surface.

blocks.altText: Squid attacking camera

content.title: India election: BBC journalist gets a call from AI-generated Trump
content.description: The BBC got to see just how easy it is to create a fake phone call between two people.

blocks.altText: BBC reporter speaks to Donald Trump via AI

content.title: BBC asks if quality of water for bathing really is improving
content.description: BBC environment correspondent talks to water minister about bathing water quality

blocks.altText: BBC Environment Correspondent Jonah Fisher asks Water Minister Robbie Moore

content.title: This is what it's like inside a black hole
content.description: A black hole is a region of space with such strong gravity not even light can escape.

blocks.altText: Black hole

content.title: 'If I were a barnacle I'd be worried'
content.description: BBC News Climate Editor Justin Rowlatt talks to a marine biologist about our warming oceans

blocks.altText: BBC News Climate Editor Justin Rowlatt talks to a marine biologist about our warming oceans

content.title: BBC Verify looks at fake AI-generated Met Gala images
content.description: Fake pictures of Katy Perry and other artists at the Met Gala went viral on social media.

blocks.altText: A picture of Katy Perry next to a picture of Marianna Spring

content.title: Family of foxes enjoy garden playtime
content.description: Aldridge gardener captures fox and five kits on camera shortly after mowing his lawn.

blocks.altText: Family of foxes

content.title: China launches rocket to far side of the Moon
content.description: The mission, billed a world first, aims to bring around two kilograms of lunar samples back to Earth.

blocks.altText: Rocket taking off

content.title: Watch: Wild orangutan treats his own wounds
content.description: It is the first time a creature in the wild has been seen using a medicinal plant to treat a wound.

blocks.altText: Orangutan with large bloody wound just below right eye

content.title: What makes a Neanderthal?
content.description: Palaeoanthropologist Emma Pomeroy describes the main features of the Shanidar Z Neanderthal skull.

blocks.altText: Shanidar Z skull

content.title: CrowdStrike boss says 97% of crashed systems fixed
content.description: It's estimated 8.5 million devices were disabled by a faulty update from the cyber-security firm.

blocks.altText: A phone with the red CrowdStrike logo of a bird of prey, placed in front of a PC screen displaying a blue error message

content.title: CrowdStrike backlash over $10 apology voucher
content.description: Cybersecurity firm is branded a "clown show" for gesture after an update caused widespread disruption.

blocks.altText: Stock image of a female office worker looking at her PC screen with an exasperated expression

content.title: Instagram removes 63,000 sextortion accounts in Nigeria
content.description: The scammers were posing as young women online to trick people into sending sexually explicit material.

blocks.altText: A girl looks sadly at her laptop. She is silhouetted to highlight the despair felt by those in this situation.

content.title: Cyber-security firm rejects $23bn Google takeover
content.description: In an internal memo to staff, Wiz's founder and chief executive said he was "flattered" by the offer.

blocks.altText: A man speaking on-stage at an event. He's wearing a blue hoody and has a smart beard and hairstyle

content.title: Google U-turn over long-running plan to ditch cookies
content.description: The UK’s privacy watchdog said it was 'disappointed' by the decision not to block internet tracking.

blocks.altText: A woman using a laptop while sitting at a table

content.title: Influencers driving extreme misogyny, say police
content.description: A new report by senior police says violence against women and girls has become a "national emergency".

blocks.altText: Influencer Andrew Tate talks to media in Romania

content.title: CrowdStrike IT outage affected 8.5 million Windows devices, Microsoft says
content.description: It’s the first time that a number has been put on the glitch that is still causing problems around the world.

blocks.altText: people at Melbourne airport

content.title: NHS warns of GP disruption next week after IT outage
content.description: Healthcare IT systems are coming back online - but GPs face a growing appointments backlog.

blocks.altText: A stock image of a GP showing a patient a paper prescription.

content.title: Scam warning as fake emails and websites target users after outage
content.description: Agencies in the UK and Australia are warning people to be vigilant to fake emails, calls and websites.

blocks.altText: A blue error screen can be seen on a checkout till at a supermarket in Australia. It is in the foreground, and behind it, a woman can be seen paying at another till.
